title.narrative: Human rights based approach to strengthening community mental health services in Somaliland

description.narrative: The project tackles Somaliland's high burden of mental health problems coupled with a weak mental health care infrastructure which is not able to provide high-quality mental health services from a human rights perspective.The project aims to increase the a ccess of people to community-based mental health services;promote the adoption of a human rights based approach to mental health in public/private mental health services;and to increase public awareness on mental health issues to decrease the stigma and di scrimination against people with mental disorders in Somaliland.A special focus is on women/girls and vulnerable groups (SGBV survivorsIDPsdisabled personsprisoners).To support the sustainability of the intervention and to promote the long-term development of the mental health care infrastructure in Somalilandthe project will increase the capacity of health care officials to promote mental health from a human rights perspective to coordinate mental health services.The main cross-cutting themes of the projec t are:health promotionhuman rightsgender equality and good governance.The main activities are: training community mental health workers and social workers to provide community mental health servicesprovision of out-patient treatmentsupporting the capacity of the MOH to plan and implement mental health services and policyand raising awareness on mental health.The main beneficiaries of the project are people in Somaliland suffering from mental disorderstheir families and communitiesvulnerable groups in need o f mental health care civil society and health officials.PSR is well positioned to carry out the project with 30+ years of experience in health development projects also of mental health projects in post-conflict contexts.PSR has long-term project experienc e in Somalia/Somaliland (2006-) and good local networks.The local partner GAVO is a well-respected local NGO with long-term experience in mental health projects.The Finnish partners FiPSR and Disability Partnership Finland have long-term experience that co ntributes closely to the project.The project contributes to the FSA project in Jubaland and collaborates with the HDI project in Somaliland
